Name: Glenys Stacey
Job/Team Function: The Executive head of Ofqual, leads a Executive Group of four directors. Responsible for the efficient and effective operation of Ofqual as the independent regulator of qualifications, examinations and assessments in England and vocational qualifications in Northern Ireland. The Chief Executive is the main point of communication with the UK Parliament and Northern Ireland Assembly, government departments, Ministers and Awarding Organisations. Also sits on the Ofqual Board.
Organisation: Office of Qualifications and Examinations Regulation

Name: Jeremy Benson
Job/Team Function: The Strategic Management Group ensures that all business and functional systems have been established and work efficiently and effectively to support Ofqual's work delivery. Services include finance and procurement, information technology, governance, legal, internal audit and building facilities, as well as Executive Office to support the Chief Executive, Chair and the Ofqual Board.
Organisation: Office of Qualifications and Examinations Regulation

Name: Francis Thomas
Job Title: Director of Internal and External Affairs
Job/Team Function: Responsible for Human Resources, customer services, investigations, internal communications, helpdesk, media, stakeholder relations, publishing and website functions of Ofqual. Responsible for ensuring that the organisation's communications with all stakeholders, internal and external, are effective and appropriate and that its HR procedures and systems work efficiently to support delivery of the regulators aims and objectives.
Organisation: Office of Qualifications and Examinations Regulation

Name: Fiona Pethick
Job/Team Function: The Regulation Group manages all regulatory policy development and operational regulation of both vocational and general qualifications. This includes setting the principles and frameworks for Ofquals regulatory approach in line with new legislation, working with stakeholders and the recognition of awarding organisations, accreditation of qualifications and monitoring of delivery. The group also encompasses the delivery of the Ofqual part of the Qualifications and Credit Framework and regulation of vocational qualificationsin Northern Ireland.
Organisation: Office of Qualifications and Examinations Regulation

Name: Dennis Opposs
Job/Team Function: The Standards Group leads Ofqual's work in setting, maintaining and monitoring standards in national assessments of 3-14 year olds. The Group also monitors and reviews the standards of operational general and vocational qualifications, accredits qualifications used by 14-19 year olds and provides expertise in assessment research.
Organisation: Office of Qualifications and Examinations Regulation
